comm: big swing, sliding down the leg side, helped on its way. Handy start

what a riposte! Full and straight, clattering into the knee-roll, and that is given out! Roy calls for a review, and there is a clear suspicion of inside-edge before the pad comes into play. A loud cheer from the crowd, but we await the umpire's verdict ... indeed it is not out!
swing, or should I say, schhher-wing! Roy is uncomfortably forward to smother that with bat and pad. Awkward

a low full toss, angling into the pads, and up goes the finger again! Blimey, it was a good case for using a second review in the over. The Aussies in the cordon were taunting him to "use it, go on!" but he didn't and it was a bad error! Hawkeye shows that was missing leg stump by a distance.
compactly forward, driven into the covers
shovelled into the leg side, the end of a lively over
on the pads, turned without power into the leg side
falling across another leg stump delivery. A squeaked appeal but nothing doing
a tight line into the pads so far this over. Hales hasn't quite got his alignment right yet as his pads wear another delivery
left alone outside off, no rush there
a bit of lift outside off, Hales chases it with a wafty bat, just about avoids the edge
firmly back in the crease. That's a maiden
drawn forward and punched into the covers
well timed drill into the covers, but safely snaffled at point
lovely ball, perfect length, nipping away and climbing as it does so. Beats everything
more lively pace and carry but the line was awry that time
wonderful flashing strike. No swing on that as Starc overpitched a fraction and Taylor battered that to the cover boundary
tucked up on leg stump with a wicket-to-wicket line. Good riposte from Starc
banged in short to complete the over. Taylor barely had to flinch to allow that to pass over his inconsiderable frame
Hales is off the mark but in no great fashion. A flat-footed swish outside off, and an inside-edge sneaks past the leg stump
left alone on length, brave judgement as the ball fizzes over the top of off
back and across, defended out to cover
excellent line and length from Hastings, a hint of nibble to keep Hales honest
fuller length from wide on the crease. Raps the pads but way down leg

so nearly dropped at point, but grabbed at the second attempt! A horrid scratchy innings comes to an end. That was his first real shot in anger, and it scooted straight at Maxwell's head, who eventually clung onto the second attempt down by his knees
line, length, swing. Lots to think about as Taylor rebuilds for England
deflected down to third man off the splice as Taylor hops into line. Intentional stroke
shovelled into the leg side and the skipper is up and running first ball
forward and drilled through the covers. Superb timing from Taylor, who has no fear of the two slips as he continues to go for his strokes
turned into the leg-side, on the drive again
rides the bounce and deflects another single down to third man. He's looking busy already in this innings
drawn forward and defends into the covers
tucked fine into the leg side and excellent scampering brings two more to the total
watchful defence
drawn forward again to meet the gentle but appreciable swing

lovely delivery! Climbed off the deck and Hastings has his reward for perseverance. Taylor's eagerness to put bat on ball is his undoing as he feathers an edge through to Wade, and now England are in serious bother
solidly forward to meet his first delivery, pushed back to mid-on
full and zipping past everything, flashing bat, and off stump remain unscathed though
nips back into the left-hander's pads, it's a rough ride for England today
forward and defended, bat and pad together
solidly forward again

yikes, now that is nasty! Morgan is in real trouble as he wears one on the helmet, a perfectly directed bouncer, but the concern on Australia's faces is genuine. The physio and doctor are out there giving him the once-over, but surely he'll have to retire hurt. It was on to him in a flash, and Morgan took his eyes off the ball at the last split-second as he ducked into it
a tame end to a ferocious over. Starc's body language is that of a man who doesn't want to have done what he's just done.
outside off, left alone
tidy line, lifting past the off stump, Stokes leaves well alone
another ball whizzes by unchallenged outside off stump
on the back foot, defended into the off side and an urgent scamper through for a single
crunched into the point region where Maxwell gathers with a leap
tickled very fine, excellent placement as the fielder dives in vain but can't intercept. Welcome runs for a rather stagnated cause
width, and no stroke offered
pushed into the covers. Starc fields in his followthrough and blows his cheeks a touch. Looks like he turned his ankle a touch. Nothing serious though
full length, well dug out
full and flumped through the covers. Can't claim he timed the pants off that, but it beat the ring of fielders and had more than enough legs. Lots of bottom hand coming into play
tighter line and defended
now that's a lovely strike. Very full bat, very full face. Drilled straight down the ground. And that will probably be that for Starc's first spell
deflected into the leg-side
width, and steered out to point, where Maxwell, of all people, misfields to gift a single. He nearly dropped one earlier too ...
outside off stump, no stroke offered
forward and defended into the covers
too full that time, and Stokes loves to drive straight. Weight going through a perfectly perpendicular bat. Beautiful
steered into the covers to a loud "no, no, no". That's a no then
back of a length, climbing into the splice and a sharp single to third man
banged in short, too short, ironic cheers
short again, over the shoulder
a nibble of width and Stokes is onto it with a measured drive to the edge of the cover boundary
defended back down the track
back of a length, punched into the covers
pushed out to cover, and a definite grimace in the followthrough. An awkward landing in a foothole?
more grimacing from Marsh, who gets incredibly tight to the stumps once again
attempted cut, but there's not enough width for the shot
wicket to wicket delivery, deflected out to point
outside off, no stroke offered
full stride and flowing drive, out to the cover sweeper. England starting to build a partnership [cue second wave of collapsing]
a swished pull out to midwicket, not especially timed but decent shot
climbing towards the pads, ricochets out to point, another quick single brings up the fifty
width, and a slash. No contact
driven back down the ground
too short, and emphatically slapped through midwicket. Powerful stroke, perfectly executed. That came at him at 90mph, but oodles of time to see it and slap it
back on a fuller length, end of the over
Marsh continues, having been clutching his side between overs
another crunching cut but Starc is in situ on the third man boundary to cut off the four
massive appeal! Very full, very straight, but given not out ... it's a review.... no bat involved, now then, is it hitting leg full enough, indeed it is! That's out!
well, that's the way to do it. See ball, hit ball for Ali as he drives fluently through the covers first ball
a similar shot second-up, but this time short cover is in the way
forward and defended to complete a successful over
a bit of nibble from back of a length, attempted steer into the covers
genuine edge, but it was straight through the gap, and wouldn't have carried at any rate. The perfect one-day shot ...
attempted back-foot biff, but the ball was a touch too full
short and scorched through midwicket, he was onto that the moment he read the length. Beautiful power and placement
short again, and Stokes attempts a glide over the slips. Can't quite reach it which is just as well as that might have been a feather to the keeper
solidly forward to a good-length delivery
edged, through the largely vacant cordon, down to third man
full length, driven back towards the bowler
full and straight, nothing doing for the batsman
forward and drilled to mid-off. Solid strike but can't find the gap
cracked to point, Maxwell lurks
looking for the quick single, but no way through. Only two from a fine over
fast and straight, Stokes bides his time
another well-judged pull shot, he picks it so early, but can't beat the field this time
squelch! Stokes wears one right in the nether-regions and even he has the good grace to laugh about it between gasps for breath
smashed on the up to point, another excellent over
a gloriously Gower-esque departure from Moeen Ali, as if to prove the earlier point! He played the shot on merit, but the upshot is an edge to the keeper and a rather desperate scoreline
good length, Willey shuffles into line and prods it tentatively to the leg side

hit on the pads, huge appeal from Marsh... and Bailey's finger goes up! Is that another one gone? Willey asks for the review, this is going to depend on whether the ball pitched in line... and Hawk-Eye says it did, bang on and straightening, would have shuddered the top of leg stump! England are six (effectively seven) down!
length ball on the off stump, there are a couple of slips waiting as Rashid pushes forward, gets a thick inside edge through backward square and a precious run for the cause
comes forward and defends solidly on off stump
fullish outside off, Stokes gently taps int the covers for a quiet end to another action-packed over
length on off stump, Rashid gets into line and shows it a straight bat
gets across his stumps and defends again
88mph length delivery on off, Rashid gets front on and blocks doggedly
now the short ball, a snorter, flying through at throat height, Rashid weaves out of the way with impressive sangfroid
back of a length, stays back and keeps the ball down, the bottom hand coming off the bat
lovely stroke, Rashid is off the mark with a crisp square drive! He can bat, make no mistake, using Cummins' pace to his own advantage and cracking it on the up through the off side
angled across from over the wicket, tapped into the off side
tough straight from Marsh, worked away off the pads with a firm clip into a gap at midwicket

brutal, Stokes continues his Neo impression with a rousing thwack down the ground for six! Skipped out to a full ball and smoked it back into the sight screen... The crowd, and all right-thinking people, liked that
draws his length back, dabbed into the covers
length outside off, this shapes back at the left-hander, he judges it well and leaves

struck on the pads, up goes the finger - Stokes is a goner, too! Very similar to the Willey dismissal, hit on the knee roll around the line of leg stump, umpire Bailey doesn't take long to make his decision and England have no more reviews. It looked a good appeal at first glance... Captain/Agent Smith and his men have snuffed out Stokes after a feisty knock
another beautifully timed stroke from Rashid, whipping a full ball off his pads through backward square for four
on the stumps, gets into line and defends
presses out and gets an inside edge through the leg side
full and swerving across the right-hander, who pushes at it and gets a thick outside edge wide of the two slips and down to third man
fires in the yorker, well-directed but Wood manages to drop his timber on it
full outside off and another thick edge squirts down to third man
lets this one go through outside off
length outside off and Wood flashes this over gully, beyond the reach of even the Super Fielder Maxwell

four more, this time shovelled over midwicket with a flick of the wrists! Had just enough on it to clear the leap of Burns and run away - cheers for the England 100. A minor achievement, in the context of the morning
pitched up and driven towards mid-on
fired down the leg side
length on off stump, Wood gets across and blocks
slightly full, tempting the drive, Wood attempts to hit the cover off again and misses this time
length ball, on middle and off, Rashid carefully lines it up in defence
short ball, rising sharply and he's in a bit of bother swatting a bottom edge past short leg for one
back of a length otuside off and Wood very nearly plays it down on to his stumps, cross-batted and it hit the bottom edge
gets across and works this into a gap through midwicket
wristy stuff from Rashid, flicking a drive through the leg side out towards the sweeper
tapped into the covers and they go scrambling through for a cheeky single
Wood tries to launch Hasting into the stands and picks out deep extra cover! His merry thrash comes to a predictably quick finish and John Hastings has three-for in an ODI for the first time
pitched up and pushed in front of square coming forwards
length outside off, shuffles into line and lets the ball through
bit of width and Rashid opens the face, steers a single through backward strike to give Topley his first taste of batting in international cricket
length on off, Topley does the basics well enough and gets into line, blocks - that's worth a big cheer today
Hastings goes wide and brings the ball back a good way, Topley was always going to leave and it passed safely over/by off stump - just
full and defended on the front foot
that's a remarkable short, not overly full and on off stump, Rashid rubberwrists a whiplash drive past mid-on and away to the boundary
Starc is bowling round the wicket, this time Rashid blocks on off stump
back and across, Rashid runs a single down to third man and gives Topley a couple of balls to survive
goes for the yorker, as you would, full on the stumps but Topley dead-bats it
pitched up again, at Toppers' toes, again he's equal to it
length in the channel from Hastings, left alone
presses forward on off stump and gets a thick edge into the leg side, they take the single
stays back and steers through gully, Topley sets off thinking about his first run but Rashid sends him back
length ball, defended half forward in front of off
a whisker away from being bowled! Topley tries something a little too advanced, rocking back and attempting a late glance to a very straight delivery... It just clears the stumps
targeting to top of off and this time Topley props forward and blocks
round the wicket and fired in, Rashid defends from the crease
angled in, worked away through backward square leg and again they'll get four balls at Topley
in the channel, wide enough to be left alone
drops back and defends solidly enough on off stump
full and wide, almost a death-overs yorker to prevent a run, Topley reaches for it and its perhaps lucky not to get an edge through to Wade
full-bunger outside off, Topley jams down on it and nearly deflects it on to his own woodwork, ricochets into the back leg and he survives another over
gets across on off stump and defends
pitched up, Rashid steps out and steers the ball in front of square
full again, fast hands from Rash as he clips towards mid-off, not quite timed
good length, drawing him forwards, hits the inside edge as he defends
touch shorter, Rashid drops back and opens the face, can't guide it past backward point
tight stuff from Hastings, length ball on the off, Rashid can't do much other than push it back to the bowler
on the stumps, mid-80s mph, defended calmly back in the crease

pushed towards point, they set off on a kamikaze run... but Maxwell's effort is wide, fizzes past George Bailey at the non-striker's end and runs for four overthrows! Topley is off the mark with a five
banged in short, Rashid ducks... and the crowd lairily greets the call of wide
short ball, drops back and pushes square
pitched up and driven firmly through the covers, they want two but there's a man out there and Topley will have to stay at the danger end
back of a length, down the leg side, flicks and misses - another extra
spears the ball in full on off stump, Topley continues to block diligently
good length on the stumps and Topley, who's getting good at this now, taps it safely away square
pitched up outside off and driven - or rather, mistimed - into the covers
full again, this time Rashid steers a push into a gap at cover and takes the single
length on off stump, Toppers blocks again
goes wide on the crease, fires the ball in at 87mph, another metronomic half-forward defensive
top of off, gets into line, straight bat again
goes back and across, this time he plays away from his body and squirts the ball down to third man - but Rashid denies Topley a run in order to keep the strike
tossed up on the stumps and swept backward of square, they elect not to run though
on the stumps and flicked with wristy insouciance through square leg, there's a couple in this
bowling round the wicket, flighted outside off, Rashid presses forward to block
skips out and there's the Dhoni helicopter again, doesn't quite connect properly and digs the ball towards mid-on
tossed up wide of the stumps, walks out and punches a single out to deep extra cover
drifts down the leg side, Topley misses with a glance but it rolls away off the pad... and they take the run this time, so Rashid obviously trusts him to face another over from Hastings
length ball, steady as she goes, defended on the stumps
short and wide and Topley wants a piece of that, slightly stiff-armed swipe and it goes over gully, down to third man on the bounce
good length on off stump, forward defensive from Rash
bit of width, decides late to run the ball to third man
on the stumps, waits for it in the crease and knocks the ball away square
fullish, on middle and off, Topley doggedly blocks once more - that's the end of Hastings, finishing with fine figures of 3 for 21
skips out and again tries whirl the ball down the ground, sends it to Agar along the ground
orthodox this time, planting the foot and sweeping hard over square leg, bounces away four
more tap from Rashid, skips out and clears mid-on, a clean swing through the line - this partnership is into the 30s
tossed up and Rashid uses the feet, attempt to heave down the ground again, screws away along the carpet past mid-on and they take the single
floated up on off, defended with the inside half of the bat
pinned in front and that's all over, red rover! The simplest lbw decision of the day, Topley playing back to one that gripped a little and straightened on off stump, plumb as a pudding
good length, nips back, hits the pad
angled across the right-hander, and Burns flirts outside off. Not a good shot but he survives
drawn forward, solid defence back down the track
outside off, lifting past the stumps. Left alone
forward again, uncomfortable defence to a tight line
shoulders arms to complete the maiden over. Tidy start
short, and shovelled round the corner, short fine leg tidies up
good full length, defended back down the track
a rowdy appeal but that was nipping back too much
forward and defended into the covers
pushed out to cover
outside off, good carry through to the keeper. Another maiden, as there was a leg bye to get Australia's innings up and running
full length, attacking the base of the stumps
Willey makes the breakthrough! No swing, that one just held its line, took the edge as Burns flapped limply outside off, and England have the vital early wicket!
outside off, swinging away, no stroke offered
on the toes, turned to short midwicket, where two men were lurking for that very stroke. And somehow he bissected them both! Smith living dangerously
climbs into the splice from back of a length. Lots of intent so far from England, who are being backed by a vocal crowd
forward and defended, another tight over, Australia aren't having it all their own way today
short, smashed on the up out to point, but easily fielded
big outswing to the right-hander, and an uneasy drive deflects off the toe
big swing again, maybe a harsh call as that went very late. Encouraging signs with the new ball though
tighter line, defended down into the crease
pushed out to point
tidy swing from Topley, demanding an honest response
drilled into the gap, but not timed, a tumbling stop limits the damage. Another good over from a pumped-up England team
opens the face to good effect, that runs away to the boundary
outside off, tempting the loose drive, but too much width that time
nasty, surprise delivery, just nips off the track to take the gloves in front of Smith's nose
tight wicket-to-wicket delivery. Defended
good areas, good areas. Smith bides his time as Willey targets the top of off
slides down the leg-side this time
defended on an off-stump line
good finish to the over, joining the dots effectively
a rare loose delivery and Finch slaps it hard in front of point. That was there to be hit, too short and too wide
tighter line, defended
short again and pulled, the runs starting to flow as Willey drops short. No cutting that off at square leg
turned into the leg-side again
short again, swished to backward square leg, and a free hit coming up ... not the ideal scenario for England
crunched down the ground. Right in the slot for the shot and England's determined start has been undone in this over
excellent finish, ghosting past the edge with a hint of lift and decent swing
turned off the hip
tight lines again
adding the top of off, a hint of swing back into the pads. Not quite the full Ryan Sidebottom but good delivery nonetheless
pushed out to cover
crashed out to cover, same direction, more aggressive shot. Same result
flicked into the leg side, beats the field. Three off the over
good areas, good wheels. As they say
inside-edged drive to short midwicket
defended to mid-on
sharp delivery, scraping past the off stump as the batsman leaves alone
forward and defended to cover
blocked back down the track. It's a maiden
nudged to midwicket from just back of a length
punched to mid-on, no width to work with here
up on his toes, driving back to the bowler who fields in his followthrough
defended once again. Australia are playing for lunch it would appear...
another maiden. Where's the hurry?

edged and gone! Smith falls in the final over before lunch! Just held its line outside off, a firm drive, snicks the edge, and England have a glimmer (no more than that) as George Bailey comes to the crease
not that way, it won't. Not much wrong with the ball but Bailey quickly onto the front foot and that is drilled through the gap
big oooh from the crowd as Wood nips one into the pads but that was going way over the stumps, as it deflects down to third man
outside off, Finch thought about having a go but shouldered arms at the last minute. 92mph that one ...
driven back to the bowler who gathers in his followthrough. Finch splits his bat in the process and anyone desperate for their lunch will have to wait even longer now ...
attacking the stumps, fended away. And that, unusually for an ODI, will be lunch
back of a length outside off, Bailey steers it into the ground towards backward point
good length, threatening to coming back in, Bailey plants his front foot and shoulders arms
comes forward to defend on off stump
pushed across outside off, this goes straight on and Bailey leaves
length ball in the channel, Bailey is happy to get his eye in again and lets it go
on the stumps, tucked short into the leg side
good length outside off, Finch shuffles out to block
86mph, dropped into the covers, they hustle through for a single
comes across and pushes the ball in front of square
back of a length, coming back in at 90mph, tucked down to short leg on the bounce... Taylor then shapes to throw at the non-striker's end
hammered! Short stuff from Wood, testing Bailey's mettle, he passes all right, whistling a pull over the crouching Taylor and away to the square leg boundary
back of a length outside off, lets this one go
pushed through outside off and Finch immediately sets about him, slashing a drive up and away over backward point
very full and wide and Finch clouts it down the ground... there's a man at long-off but the shot comfortably clears him! Finch isn't going to muck about with the target now in double figures
flatter outside off, maybe a googly, Finch plays this watchfully
down the leg side, a googly that spins and flicks the pad on its way past Bairstow
Bailey is weighing anchor still, defends on his stumps
tossed up, another googly, stays back and blocks
tapped into the covers and they pinch a risky single, the throw would have challenged Finch's footspeed... but only if it was on target
ripper of a delivery from Wood, climbing rapidly past the outside edg as Bailey prods at it
pitched up a little further, 91mph and blocked coming forwards
slightly short and crashed through point, using the pace of a 92mph delivery, there was width and he played the cut well, keeping on top of the ball
full length, steps out to drive but finds the man in front of square
pitched up and this time Bailey pushes-and-runs wide of mid-off for a comfortable single
flighted, legbreak on off stump, pushed gently back to the bowler
googly, outside off, punched through the covers in front of the man in the deep
drags this down and Bailey hoicks it over midwicket, there's a man in the deep - prompting a shout of "catch!" from Rashid - but it was placed well in front of him and bounces away
floated up wide of the stumps, spinning into the keeper's gloves as Bailey leaves
four more, carted high and wide of mid-on, this was struck really powerfully, going back to a ball that skidded on
another short ball from Rashid and clubbed away out towards deep midwicket for a third boundary in the over - Australia are past the halfway mark
good length in the channel, controlled dab wide of third man and they come back for two
fullish, defended coming forwards
sumptuous drive, too full from Wood and it's bullied back through mid-off, Topley thinks he's in the race but ultimately gets nowhere near pulling it in
full again, Finch clubs another menacing drive but Wood snatches it up in his follow through
slightly false shot, closing the face and gets a leading edge back down the track
oh, fetch that, too full and too straight and whipped away through midwicket for four more - that's the 50 stand, almost all of them in the six overs since the interval
flighted outside off, reaches out and pushes towards a gap at mid-off
tossed up, straightening in the channel, poked into the off side
pushed through outside off, drops back and cuts but finds backward point
full on the stumps, worked to leg but midwicket cuts it off
floated up on the stumps, Finch plays around his pad but gets plenty of bat on a sweep through backward square, another boundary
flat and a bit quicker outside off, into the keeper's gloves as Finch goes back and sticks out a pad
pushed through on the stumps, glanced through midwicket
flat on middle and off, punched back to the bowler
pretty fast, flat offspin, 58mph on the stumps, down on one knee to sweep to deep backward square
darted in on off stump, worked to midwicket coming forwards
pushed through on off, Bailey cautiously taps it back to the bowler
shuffles outside off, Moeen sends it down flat, plays late with whatever turn there is but sends it along the ground to short fine leg
floated up outside off, tapped into the covers reaching forwards
flighted, on off stump, driven back down the ground past the bowler
gives it some air, Bailey gets across and punches through the covers for one more into the deep
drags this short, on the legs, tucked through backward square to the man on the boundary
tossed up wide of the stumps, drives with an open face, behind deep point for a couple
flighted, big wind up from Bailey but his drive finds short extra cover
on the stumps, Finch swings those meaty forearms through a sweep and gets it fine enough for four - that's the Australia 100
some spin, coming back in to hit the pads... but I think he was outside the line
swept hard and the ball goes flying away through backward point for another four, Finch raises his bat for a typically brisk fifty
tossed up outside off, goes down to sweep again and is hit on the body
pushed through, Finch waits in his crease and defends
on the stumps, nudged through the leg side
round the wicket, angled in and tucked to the leg side
slower ball, outside off, tapped gently into the covers
shortish, down the leg side, Finch swats at it and misses... not called wide
this one is, however, a bumper veering to leg as Finch tries to pull
beautiful shot, touch full and crumped back past mid-on to the fence
good length, 84mph outside off stump, sits back and runs one more to third man
fullish, pushed back into the off side
tossed up, Finch is down early to sweep one towards deep backward square
on the stumps, Bailey follows suit and paddles one towards fine leg
tossed up, swept into a gap this time and they come back for the second
finds the boundary this time, taking another delivery from outside off and muscling it to deep backward square between two fielders
gets lucky, having a go at Moeen, tried to sock him down the ground and instead sent a steepler into the off side... but it landed safely, no one nearby
darted in on the stumps and pushed towards mid-on
short ball, over the batsman, think maybe a wide on height... and they steal another running to the keeper
slower ball, back of a length, waits on it and paddles down to fine leg
angled in from round the wicket, just a scratch of bat on it from Bailey sends the ball fine to the boundary
short, at the body, hits the thigh pad and dribbles into the leg side
another cutter, waits for it and tucks one more through square off the hips
length ball on off stump, shuffles into line and blocks back to the bowler
takes the pace off again, Bailey isn't fooled, rocks back to pull one more to deep backward square
tossed up full and quite wide, into the gloves as Bailey leaves it alone
pushed through outside off, reverses the hands and swipes one more to short third man
length ball, flat outside off, drops back and nurdles another single through square leg
flat on off stump, nudged along the carpet with a close of the bat face, straight to backward square
chipped down the ground, Bailey places this rather than attempts to hit a homer, the fielder runs round to wide long-on to cut it off
pushed through outside off, reverse-swept again but straight to the fielder
back of a length and clipped through square leg
outside off, Bailey has a swish and gets a thick edge down to third man... They've rattled them off, meaning Australia win by eight wickets and take the series 3-2
